content:
image.png
I see some deriving handlers, they return false when they see things unsupported (like mkDecEq), but isn't it better to provide an error message? I see the monad CommandElabM has a throwError method, shall we use that instead?
@James Gallicchio told me return false means it's unsupported, so the semantics is better than I expected, I thought it means fail
Tesla Zhang has marked this topic as resolved.
